title: of the Fisheries (Amendment) Act, 1997 (No. 23 of 1997) and the Sea-Fisheries,
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Aquaculture Licensing Appeals
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Aquaculture Licensing Appeals 

(Fees) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on the 8 December 2021
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited aquaculture licensing appeal (fees) regulation 2021 (2) regulation come operation 8 december 2021

title: of the Fisheries (Amendment) Act, 1997 (No. 23 of 1997) and the Sea-Fisheries,
heading: 3. (1) A person making an appeal shall pay a fee to the Board in the amount
text_raw:
3. (1) A person making an appeal shall pay a fee to the Board in the amount 
specified in column 2 of the Schedule opposite the mention in column 1 of the 
Schedule of the class or description of appeal concerned. 

(2) A person making an appeal shall not be entitled to a refund of any fee 
paid to the Board in respect of that appeal where the appeal is withdrawn or the 
provisions of section 54 of the Act apply.
text_norm: 3 (1) person making appeal shall pay fee board amount specified column 2 schedule opposite mention column 1 schedule class description appeal concerned (2) person making appeal shall entitled refund fee paid board respect appeal appeal withdrawn provision section 54 act apply

title: of the Fisheries (Amendment) Act, 1997 (No. 23 of 1997) and the Sea-Fisheries,
heading: 4. (1) A person making a request to the Board for an oral hearing shall pay
text_raw:
4. (1) A person making a request to the Board for an oral hearing shall pay 

a fee of €75 to the Board. 

(2) The fee referred to in paragraph (1) shall be payable in addition to any 

fee payable by virtue of Regulation 3. 

(3) A person referred to in paragraph (1) may, by written notice, withdraw 
such a request before the Board has decided whether or not to hold an oral 
hearing of the appeal. 

(4) Withdrawal of a request for an oral hearing shall not give rise to an 

entitlement to a refund of any fee paid to the Board in relation to such request. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 25th January, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [771] 3

title: of the Fisheries (Amendment) Act, 1997 (No. 23 of 1997) and the Sea-Fisheries,
heading: 5. (1) The Aquaculture Licensing Appeals (Fees) Regulations 1998 (S.I. No.
text_raw:
5. (1) The Aquaculture Licensing Appeals (Fees) Regulations 1998 (S.I. No. 

449 of 1998) are revoked. 

(2) Any reference made in an instrument to the Regulations revoked by 
paragraph (1) shall, from the commencement of these Regulations, be construed 
as a reference to these Regulations. 

(3) Where, immediately before the commencement of these Regulations, any 
fee was payable under the Regulations revoked by paragraph (1), such fee 
remains payable as if those Regulations had not been revoked.

title: of the Fisheries (Amendment) Act, 1997 (No. 23 of 1997) and the Sea-Fisheries,
heading: 1. An appeal by an applicant for a licence against
text_raw:
1. An appeal by an applicant for a licence against 
a decision by the Minister in respect of that 
application.

heading: 2. An appeal by the holder of a licence against
text_raw:
2. An appeal by the holder of a licence against 
the revocation or amendment of that licence by 
the Minister.

title: of the Fisheries (Amendment) Act, 1997 (No. 23 of 1997) and the Sea-Fisheries,
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations prescribe the fees payable to the Aquaculture Licences 
Appeals Board in relation to appeals to the Board under Section 40 of the 
Fisheries (Amendment) Act, 1997 (No. 23) including oral hearings of such 
appeals, against Ministerial decisions on aquaculture licence applications or to 
revoke or amend aquaculture licences.
